result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth D Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Day Reporting Center. Huber privileges under Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work and treatment. Electronic monitoring only as to the 5 MONTHS sentence only.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes: MUST provide a DNA sample. Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees during the period of probation; or, if revoked, Defendant shall pay up to 25% of prison funds. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program, and any other programming deemed appropriate by the Department and or the agent.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Random urine screens. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealing.
As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons. Defendant shall not vote until civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges under Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work and treatment. Defendant DOES NOT qualify for Electronic Monitoring as to the Condition Time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth D Nelson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Statement made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction / Day Reporting Center to run consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 5 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work and treatment. 

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS
with the following conditions as to probation:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees during the period of probation; Or, if revoke, Defendant shall pay up to 25% of prison funds. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  Electronic monitoring only as to the 5 MONTHS sentence only.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment and treatment.
*  Random urine screens. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealing.
*  MUST provide a DNA sample.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons.
*  Defendant shall not vote until civil rights are restored.
*  Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program, and any other programming deemed appropriate by the Department and or the agent.

CONDITION OF PROBATION:  COURT SENTENCED Defendant to serve 30 DAYS condition time at the House of Correction with Huber privileges under Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work and treatment. Defendant DOES NOT qualify for Electronic Monitoring as to the Condition Time.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form

Defendant Kenneth D Nelson in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Kenneth D Nelson in court with attorney Adam Galaviz for attorney Reyna I Morales.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Hanna Kolberg.
BRANCH 3 FOR BRANCH 26.
NO FILE IN COURT.
Court addresses violation report.  Defendant tested positive for THC.  Defendant warned.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court informs defendant that bail will be modified if he continues to test positive.  Court increases defendants supervision to ENHANCED with Justice Point.  Case remains scheduled for plea hearing on 5/8/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 26.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Defendant Kenneth D Nelson in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Kolberg).  Plea hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth D Nelson in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Nathaniel Adamson for Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/18/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kenneth D Nelson in court with attorney Adam Galaviz.  Defendant Kenneth D Nelson in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
